post.author: BNA!
post.body:
This forum is meant to show off and release the final version of the map you've been working on.

Don't post "my new map" or I'll kill you, literally speaking.

Give it a name like yournick_dm_1 or whatever and use that as headline, please!

As the first two letters in the headline please add "SP" for single player or "MP" for multi player.

Posting screenshots is very fine, yet please don't throw in 20 screens at 1600*1200 - limit yourself to 3 or 4 good shots or the special cases you want to show off. The maximum image size width shouldn't be over 640 pixels - if you have higher resolution images, please post text links to them.

If not I'll edit them out completely - not everyone has broadband, let alone the fact that the page will become unreadable...

If you have gathered enough feedback in the Maps WIP froum and tweaked your map to the max, then release it here under the SAME headline as in the Maps WIP forum.

When done so add the link to the WIP version to your release thread - so you increase chances that your map will get more playtime by people who only follow one of the forums.

The web was meant to find and share information faster and easier - not to confuse people and steal their time by searching around.

If you do different versions of your map, please DON'T start a new thread for each one!

post.author: urgrund
post.body:
Perhaps there should be protocol in place to stop these 'box' map's being posted in final.

Maybe state that before you post in Final you have to post at minimum one Beta release in WIP. How can you possibly call a map final if you have had zero user feedback? Maps are for users - so get their input.

Kinda dissapointing, and somewhat frustrating, to see all these amatuer 'first go' maps being posted in Final when they're well and truely not.

Feedback from 'Final' releases (IMO) should only be bug hunting. All the other feedback (which most of these "final" maps recieve)is what WIP is for. Release betas... get peoples feedback, let other people find bugs and glitches you miss... let other people test with 8players... re-asses, re-asses, re-asses... then post in the 'Final' forum.

</rant>

post.author: Feffer
post.body:
urgrund wrote:
Maybe state that before you post in Final you have to post at minimum one Beta release in WIP. How can you possibly call a map final if you have had zero user feedback? Maps are for users - so get their input.


This i have to disagree on, to some degree. I mean, i agree that, specifically for multiplayer, you need playtesting for a map to come together, but that doesn't mean that a multi- or single player maps needs to be tested publically. If the person does there testing internally or from another site then why should the post it as a wip here as well?

As for your other concerns (ie the steamy piles of 1's and 0's that some people call maps) its going to happen anywhere that people publically release maps. Some of it is that the authors are new/young and really don't know. Some people are just wankers. For those people who don't know any better the only way to learn that is to put their 'final' map out and have people tell them how bad it is. They'll either take it to heart and try to make a better (ie real) map or just stop mapping from frustration (and given how much effort making a good map is this isn't necessarily always a bad thing - making maps isn't for everyone)

I've talked to BNA! though about getting a review section up (and he was pretty positive about it) over the 'final maps' so that should be one way to augment beforehand if a map is even worth it. Another is to check the feedback. a third is to look at the screenshots. Also though, worse comes to worse, you do a 2 min download, 1 min of 'wow this is bad' and them 'whooomph', into the recycle bin.
